info.title: custom cursor
info.text: In this example I've created a custom mouse cursor, hover over the blank page to see what the cursor looks like. This custom cursor was designed by bokuwatensai.

info.title: cursor property
info.text: It's not uncommon to change the mouse cursor when hovering over specific elements, for example you might change a button's CSS to cursor: pointer; so that the default arrow cursor is replaced with a pointing hand to indicate that the button is clickable.

info.title: custom url
info.text: But you can also create a custom cursor for your entire page by applying the cursor property to your body. Instead of using one of the built-in values like "pointer", we can use our own image by writing a path to a particular file using the same CSS url() function we use for background-images, followed by ", auto".

info.title: size limit
info.text: It's important to note, that most browsers will restict the maximum allowed image file size which can be used as a cursor, usually to 128px wide and 128px high. Most custom cursor's tend to be around 32px wide by 32px high.
